title: Strengthening Learning Design Practical Competencies: Elementary Mathematics Computational Thinking via Non-Programming Plugged Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Instructional design competency enhancement program for professionals in education/teaching/learning fields

learning_goals: Learners can explain three sub-elements of computational thinking (decomposition, algorithms, problem-solving) for solving elementary math problems.
Learners can suggest over two specific methods for designing computational thinking activities in math classes without programming.
Learners can apply math problem-solving strategies using unplugged computing tools (flowcharts, pseudocode, etc.) to real-world cases.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
